reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My sister and I spent one month travelling Bali and Lombok and our stay in Gili Meno at the sunset Gecko was our favorite part of the entire trip! First of all Gili Meno itself is heaven on earth- Just a tiny little island with some great beaches and a laid back vibe. we went over to Gili Trawangan for the day, an knew we had made the right choice to stay on Meno. The sunset Gecko is an eco-friendly place with outdoor showers that recycle the water- you're given natural soap on arrival. There is a snorkelling spot right out the front, and I spent many days simply floating along, following turtles and admiring the coral. The food served there is amazing, and we watched as fresh seafood was delivered, and we chose our meal for the night. The staff are amazingly friendly and became friends to us during our stay, some of us still keep in touch on facebook! I cannot say enough good things about this place- I absolutely loved it, and I know one day I will be going back!!!
reviews.title: The Highlight of one month in Bali and Lombok!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my partner stayed here for 5 nights in November, 2011 and had a wonderful time. The best thing about this place is that the staff are genuinely helpful and friendly. They try their best to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Hiro - san, the guy who runs this place is an angel. He makes sure you get whatever you ask for. It was very sweet of him to look around and find us a reliable and good dive shop when we wanted to do some diving. He knows the island very well and advised us on the good snorkelling spots too. The hotel is conveniently located and you get to see great sun sets from the restaurant area.
reviews.title: 'Hero" of Gili Meno.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We definitely plan to stay there again. May the Gecko's protect you till then. :)
reviews.title: paradise at your doorstep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Love from India.
reviews.title: My own personal paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for 5 nights in late June. It was a truly wonderful experience. The place is rustic with a real eco feel. We were in an A frame with an a shared outdoor bathroom. The room was small but cool enough with only windows and fan and a good mosquito net. The real charm of the place is sitting on the beach edge watching the madness on gili t whilst sipping on a fruit shake or beer and then going for a snorkel with turtles. The restuarant is great with the fish in particular being amzing.
reviews.title: A little bit a paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed here with some friends for only 2 nights. It's a little bit of a task to actually get to the place, but it's well worth it in my opinion. Everyone was so friendly and helpful, we really felt at home and were sad when it came time to leave. The airlines had lost one of our group member's luggage en route and we were really impressed by how helpful the staff was. They called the airline twice on our behalf and even called the boat my friend was out diving on when it arrived. There's not a whole lot to do on Gili Meno, so this is a good place to go if you want to just lie on the beach with a good book, maybe do some diving, and some serious relaxing.
reviews.title: Amazing get away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009
reviews.text: As a word of warning, as soon as the sun goes down the mosquitoes come out in hordes. We learned our lesson the first night as we were attacked during dinner to the point that we couldn't even eat our food because we were covered with the insects. Fortunately one of the staff at the restaurant brought some insect repellant for us to use- apparently the kind we were wearing wasn't so effective on Indonesian mosquitoes.
reviews.title: Good place but overall too much sacrfice for this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I found out the Sunset Gecko in the internet, I already tempted to make a booking, cause the fotos are superb. When I arrived at the place, I looked at the building with wonder. Oh beautiful, with a quit surrouding n private beach... But then when went to the room, the facts came. The actual building is a wooden building ... In the room for single they just put a thin cover on top of the floor with a mosquito net. That's all. In twin room they provide 2 wooden bed with thim matras. The bed linen was actually a rug, n during my three days stay, they haven't even changed it. The room floor is never wept. Dust everywhere. And you can see spidernet everywhere over the roof. The light is so low so you almost cannot read anything, the open window system (which are not easy to close) invited hundred mosquitos. The beach is ok... But there are many more beautiful side also in Gili Meno. The access is so difficult, the transport only a horse cart, and you can waiting for hours. The easiest access by walking takes around 45 minute to 1 hour to the more busy area. They do not have internet access.The food price also too high if you comparing to the same meal at the other restaurants at gili meno. And the room and meals are not including tax 10 percent, The room price is not including with breakfast also. And the worst things I found some cockroach and lices in my room. If you still insit to come, please check under the matrass, dust everywhere... For price 125.000 twins room, 150.000 for a-frame room, n 450.000 for a bigger room with the farthest distance, I do not recommend this place. The staffs even friendly, do not have any obligation to clean your room everyday and even changing the bedlinen... !!! So even others still say it's beautiful but for hygiene I won't back to this place.
reviews.title: The best part of our honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Every hotel was full (including Sunset Gecko) when I tried to make reservations but Hiro was amazingly helpful and accomodating and offered to let us stay in the almost finished Beach Front bungalow #2. It was beautiful and will be even more so once it is finished! We only planned to stay 2 nights on Gili Meno, but loved it so much we stayed 5! It is a true paradise island and staying at Sunset Gecko was perfect. Breakfast right on the beachfront was particularly wonderful. The staff are all very friendly and helpful and the environmentally friendly aspects of the hotel are very well thought out. This was hands down the best part of our honeymoon in Bali! Thank you Hiro and Sunset Gecko staff!
reviews.title: Amazing place to chill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We (party of 4 ) stayed at The Sunset Gecko for 5 nights in May and were all thrilled by this place. We booked the Beachfront Bungalow, which has a beautiful view out to the ocean and a gorgeous private outdoor bathroom.
reviews.title: Perfect place for a getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have been to the Sunset Gecko three times now and it has always been a great place but on my recent visit last week I was saddened and dismayed by how run down the place is getting. The building materials are starting to fall apart, the furnishings are getting shabby and the staff are pretty damn lazy (apart from Alex, he's a champion) There are so many maintenance issues that could be being taken care of by the staff each day to keep on top of things but they are content to sit around playing guitar and making excuses.
reviews.title: What happened to the Gecko?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The quality of the food was very very average and the service was lacklustre. Each time we wanted food or more beer we had to get up and go to the kitchen to ask. They whould have been watching and doing the rounds. We stayed two nights and on the last morning we were informed that they had no more mangoes or oranges for breakfast juice. This may sound petty but it is a hotel after all an the prices aren't cheap! The excuse was that the boat was broken (a lie) as the public boat comes and goes from the mainland every single day.
reviews.title: A solid option - go for an A-frame bungalow *

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know that the owner lives abroad and I hope he becomes aware of the lack of interest of his staff while he is away and that they are running his once great business into the ground.
reviews.title: A nice place in the middle of nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a beautiful location and we had a great time lazing on a tropical desert island in spite of the service and state of play but I will unfortunately not be going back, and that is a crying shame.
reviews.title: bagus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Okay - Sunset Gecko was a pleasant surprise - it's very laid back and works on Indonesian time...so if you ask for something or order food then expect to wait...but this is all part and parcel of the experience and you do leave here extremely chilled out.
reviews.title: Mixed impressions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights in Sunset Gecko, very happy with it's location and amenities. The crew is friendly, even though some don't speak much English. The bungalows are basic, but nobody hides that - what you see (on their website) is what you get. Fair enough.
reviews.title: Great choice for a bungalow stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're a fellow backpacker, or simply want a no-frills place to stay, Sunset Gecko will be satisfactory - at the very least. We loved it and we would gladly come back.
reviews.title: Three months on and I still dream about this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The breakfast is not included in the price of the room/bungalow, but it's all right. We did dine elsewhere though, sometimes just 50 meters to the right, at The Good Heart.
reviews.title: beach bungalow no 1

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do book in advance. Even though we arrived at the beginning of the low season, Sunset Gecko was full. That couldn't have been said of many other stays on Gili Meno, a recommendation by itself.
reviews.title: Lovely spot, dirty, soiled sheets, cushions and pillows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, it is a little more expensive than a lot of the ither backpacker options on Gili Meno but the location is absolutely unbeatable. In the evenings, Sunset Gecko occupies the best beach to view the sunset on and it is truly beautiful. Rooms are pretty basic beach bungalow affairs but a lot of them are built of two floors and have balconys that make for excellent views. There is a great relaxed atmosphere here, staff always made us feel so welcome and it was a nice place to sip a beer with fellow travellers in the evening. The food at the restaurant was great, though sometimes it could take a while to arrive. That's the only negetive thing that I can think of. I would stay here again!
reviews.title: Not good value
